abstracts.cdata!:
The Ghana Public Enterprise and
            Privatization Technical Assistance Project had
            unsatisfactory outcome, likely sustainability, modest
            institutional development impact, and overall unsatisfactory
            performance for both Bank and Borrower. Lessons learned
            include rethinking private sector participation arrangements
            and focusing on improving the general business environment
            through increasing access, affordability and sustainability
            of a minimum infrastructure platform, and reducing the cost
            of doing business. Other lessons include taking into account
            political realities, measuring Government commitment,
            improving communication with the public and garnering
            support, aptly matching the technical assistance component
            to the overall country dialogue and strategy, and providing
            for redundancies and retraining as an integral part of
            privatization since it profoundly affects public opinion and
            government commitment.
